Description: Butt-end of a wooden axe-haft: charred at the top and much abraded. On the base is an inscription, which was once continued on the inner face of the haft with a conventional presentation formula, of which there now survives only the first word. The inscription was incised and then filled with yellow pigment. Some of the pigment is lost. There is a small surface crack in the cartouche.

From the Earliest Kings to the XVIth Dynasty’ 10th ed. revised (London, 1923), 219-20; J. von Beckerath, ‘Untersuchungen zur politischen Geschichte der Zweiten Zwischenzeit in Ägypten’ (Glückstadt, 1964), 242, XIII 21(1 3).
